KF é  um coop multiplayer onde os jogadores tem de sobreviver a cada Wave(onda de inimigos) e fazer valer cada munição no cartucho. O objetivo é sobreviver até o Patriarch(pai dos zeds - criaturas do jogo) que com estratégia e explosivos pode facilitar a vida pois enfrentá-lo de frente é morte na certa. O jogo utiliza de perks(habilidades individuais; entre elas estão combate corpo a corpo; atirador , médico, granadeiro, especialista em armas pesadas, até encendeadores; resta ao jogador escolher qual habilidade é mais precisa no mapa escolhido. A facilidade de fazer amigos e a diversão é garantida se você gosta de um coop e trabalho em equipe é mais do que recomendado ter esse jogo em sua biblioteca.

HEY YOU! YES, YOU THERE WITH THE GLAZED LOOK CONSUMING YOUR GAZE. DO YOU LIKE PLAYING VIDEO GAMES WHERE YOU SHOOT THINGS IN ORDER TO PROGRESS TO SHOOTING MORE THINGS? DO YOU LIKE BRITISH ACCENTS? DO YOU HAVE HANDS AND ENJOY BREATHING AIR? WELL BUDDY I HAVE THE GAME FOR YOU!

Despite the fact it was delivered unto us from above in 2009, the game still stands up really well, even more so if the likeminded sociopaths you call "friends" play alongside you.
Play with jolly good cooperation in mind, or, and this is just me spitballing here, go through a door before a friend gets through and start welding it shut, all the while listening to their agonizing screams as they're eventually overrun by the hoard.

Buy it on sale or don't, it's worth it either way.

This game, by all means, is a master piece. While the second game is out now, the sheer amount of fun that can still be had on this game, as well as the nostalgic memories that it provided of years earlier. Was simply fantastic. Obviously the game is better when played with friends, and there are still more than enough servers to do whatever combination of wave length and difficulty you want. 

The simple mechanics of the game goes as.
> Shoot gun
> Kill Zeds
> Get money
> Nearly die
> Get more money
> Buy a bigger gun. 

Combining this with the three different classes put into the game, it allows for a person to play more to what they are akin to doing. 

A personal favorite will always be the Lever-Action Rifle on MountainPass, while it is one of the cheapest guns in the game, it is just so much fun to use (And it still packs a punch on hard difficulty). 

The lack of crosshairs make the same a little dicey, but due to this, you have nothing to blame but your own ability to aim a gun for missing. 

Regardless, super fun, would recommend 10/10 times. Competing against your friend for kills, the variation in maps, the music works perfectly, the gore and the guns all work together to make what is, and will always be a classic game that can always be turned back to. 

10/10, do recomment, Go support Specialist and lock your friends out of the trader.

Pros : This game is a lot of fun. It runs on a toaster, the gunplay is excellent, class variety is well done and the game can be a real challenge at times. 

Cons : you have to grind A LOT do advance in class level and it is not rewarding. Also it gets kinda repetitive.

[h1]名作ゾンビゲー[/h1]

後継作あります：[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/232090/Killing_Floor_2/]Killing Floor2[/url]

ゾンビゲーといえばこれか[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/550/Left_4_Dead_2/]L4D2[/url]かというぐらいの名作だと思っています。
こちらはキャンプ（留まって敵のウェーブに対処），L4D2は目的地に走り抜けるイメージです。プレイスタイルに合わせてお好きな方をどうぞ。
Amazing game, hours and hours of fun!!!

Hacia años que no jugaba a un videojuego y este ha hecho que vuelva a jugar. Es antiguo pero ofrece mucho más que muchos de hoy en día y eso que no cuenta con muchos modos de juego, pero aunque podrían haber añadido más puntos al juego como más modos o más jefes finales, lo que tiene es simplemente perfecto, clases bien pensadas para cooperativo, inmersión perfecta al juego por sus mapas, personajes, música y enemigos y algun extra que no esperaba encontrar como tiempo bala o muchos toques de steampunk que al menos para mí lo hacen el mejor juego cooperativo que he jugado nunca. Lo volvería a comprar sin duda, es de los que más horas le voy a dedicar.
